pr_title: Reject the NULL character in paths in StrictHttpFirewall

timeline.bodyText: Will you please change the copyright to be 2020 for both files?
timeline.author: jzheaux

replies.bodyText: Since you also changed StrictHttpFirewallTests, will you please change the copyright there, too?
replies.author: jzheaux

timeline.bodyText: Will you please add a @since 5.4 annotation to this JavaDoc?
timeline.author: jzheaux
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -281,6 +287,24 @@ public void setAllowBackSlash(boolean allowBackSlash) { } } + /** + *

+ * Determines if a null "\0" or a URL encoded nul "%00" should be allowed in + * the path or not. The default is not to allow this behavior because it is a frequent + * source of security exploits. + *

+ * + * @param allowNull a null "\0" or a URL encoded null "%00" be allowed

timeline.message:
Reject the NULL character in paths in StrictHttpFirewall

Adds `setAllowNull`
By default, denies null in paths

Reject the NULL character in paths in StrictHttpFirewall

Adds `setAllowNull`
By default, denies null in paths
